intro: Cymodocea serrulata, commonly known as the narrow-leaf seagrass, is a marine flowering plant belonging to the family Potamogetonaceae. It is characterized by its narrow, grass-like leaves and is typically found in shallow coastal waters. This species plays a vital role in marine ecosystems by stabilizing sediments and providing habitat for various marine organisms. Cymodocea serrulata thrives in brackish to saltwater environments, often growing in dense underwater meadows. Its reproductive structures are adapted for underwater pollination, contributing to its ecological significance in coastal zones.
